speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः| ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् || 18.55 ||
translation: By devotion, he knows Me in truth, who and what I am; then, having known Me in truth, he immediately enters into the Supreme.
question: What is the primary ingredient for spiritual growth? Is Bhakti useful for spiritual growth? Is Bhakti necessary for spiritual growth?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः| मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् || 18.56 ||
translation: Having taken refuge in Me and doing all actions, by My grace he obtains the eternal, indestructible state of being.
question: Is God's grace required for spiritual growth?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः| बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव || 18.57 ||
translation: Mentally renouncing all actions in Me, having Me as the highest goal, and resorting to the yoga of discrimination, do thou ever fix thy mind on Me.
question: What is the concept of surrender? Why should we surrender to God?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि| अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि || 18.58 ||
translation: Fixing your mind on Me, you shall, by My grace, overcome all obstacles; but if you will not hear Me due to egoism, you shall perish.
question: Is God kind to his devotees? What happens if we do not pay heed to God?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे| मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति || 18.59 ||
translation: If, filled with egoism, thou thinkest, "I will not fight," then thy resolve is vain; nature will compel thee.
question: Was it possible for Arjuna to actually give up fighting in the war?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा| कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् || 18.60 ||
translation: O Arjuna, bound by your own Karma (action) born of your own nature, that which from delusion you wish not to do, even that you shall do helplessly.
question: Is there free will? Is destiny more powerful than free will? Are we free to decide what to do?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति| भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया || 18.61 ||
translation: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing all beings, by His illusory power, to revolve as if mounted on a machine.
question: Does God reside in all beings?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत| तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् || 18.62 ||
translation: Fly to Him for refuge with all your being, O Arjuna; by His grace you will obtain supreme peace and the eternal abode.
question: Why should we worship God? Why should we pray to God? What happens by prayer or worship?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया| विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु || 18.63 ||
translation: Thus, wisdom more secret than secrecy itself has been declared to you by me. Reflect on it fully, then act as you wish.
question: Was Arjuna free to decide not to fight?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः श्रृणु मे परमं वचः| इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् || 18.64 ||
translation: Hear again My supreme word, most secret of all; for you are dearly beloved of Me, I will tell you what is good.
question: Why did Krishna teach the knowledge of Yoga to Arjuna? Why did Krishna choose Arjuna to deliver his message?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु| मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे || 18.65 ||
translation: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow down to Me. You will come to Me; I truly promise you this, for you are dear to Me.
question: What did Krishna ask Arjuna to do finally? Did Krishna assure Arjuna of victory in the war?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज| अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः || 18.66 ||
translation: Abandon all duties and take refuge in Me alone; I will liberate you from all sins; do not grieve.
question: Did Krishna assure Arjuna of liberation or salvation? What is the core message of the Gita? What is the essence of the Gita? What is the most important verse in the Gita?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन| न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति || 18.67 ||
translation: Never speak this to one who is devoid of austerities or devotion, who does not render service, who does not desire to listen, or who cavils at Me.
question: Should the knowledge of Yoga be imparted to everybody?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति| भक्ितं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः || 18.68 ||
translation: He who, with supreme devotion to Me, teaches this supreme secret to My devotees, shall undoubtedly come to Me.
question: What happens to those who spread the message of the Gita?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्िचन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः| भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि || 18.69 ||
translation: There is no one among men who does service dearer to Me, nor shall there be anyone on earth dearer to Me than him.
question: Does God like those who serve others?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः| ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः || 18.70 ||
translation: And he who studies this sacred dialogue of ours, by him I shall have been worshipped through the sacrifice of wisdom; such is my conviction.
question: What happens to those who indulge in dialogue and debate about the scriptures? Is it advisable to indulge in dialogue and debate abou the scriptures?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च श्रृणुयादपि यो नरः| सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् || 18.71 ||
translation: Also, the man who hears this, full of faith and free from malice, shall attain to the happy worlds of those of righteous deeds, and be liberated.
question: What happens to those who listen to this knowledge with faith?

speaker: भगवान
sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा| कच्चिदज्ञानसंमोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय || 18.72 ||
translation: Has this been heard, O Arjuna, with one-pointed focus? Has the delusion of your ignorance been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?
question: What did Krishna finally ask Arjuna at the end of the Gita?

speaker: अर्जुन
sanskrit: नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत| स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव || 18.73 ||
translation: Arjuna said, "My delusion has been destroyed, for I have gained my knowledge (memory) through Your grace, O Krishna. I am now free from doubts. I will act according to Your word."
question: Did Arjuna's delusion get destroyed?

speaker: सञ्जय
sanskrit: इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः| संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् || 18.74 ||
translation: Sanjaya said, Thus, I have heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes one's hair to stand on end.
question: Did Sanjaya have any physical signs of emotion after completion of the Gita?

speaker: सञ्जय
sanskrit: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम्| योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् || 18.75 ||
translation: Through the grace of Vyasa, I have heard this supreme and most secret Yoga, directly from Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, Himself declaring it.
question: By whose grace did Sanjaya get to hear the Gita?

speaker: सञ्जय
sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम्| केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः || 18.76 ||
translation: O King, remembering this wonderful and holy dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna, I continually rejoice.
question: Was Sanjaya happy after hearing the full Gita?

speaker: सञ्जय
sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः| विस्मयो मे महान् राजन् हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः || 18.77 ||
translation: And, remembering again and again that most wonderful form of Hari, I am filled with great wonder, O King; and I rejoice again and again.
question: Why was Sanjaya happy after hearing the full Gita?

speaker: सञ्जय
sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः| तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम || 18.78|
translation: Wherever Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, is; and wherever Arjuna, the wielder of the bow, is; there is prosperity, victory, happiness, and a firm policy; this is my conviction.
question: What did Sanjaya predict about the war?
